kb.ai-models.user_prompts.prompt_help: Defines the way we want the system to act when we ask a question. Here we can define more specific rules, that could even override the defined behavior. kb.ai-models.user_prompts.system_help: Defines general personality traits of the assistant, or about how it should behave when answering questions/ during a conversation. For example, we could define that the system will answer as a health professional.

prompt-lab.configuration.prompts.example:
Taking into account this context:
{context}
Give a detailed answer to this question:
{question} . 
If you do not find an answer in the context, say that you don't have enough data.

Taking into account this provided context.
    Context:
    {context}
    Answer this question like a medical professional.:
 "{question}"

stash.settings.processes.classifier_info: In order to get accurate label search suggestions, existing content has to be labeled. As more content is labeled, training will improve. You can create new labels from the label sets page.
stash.settings.processes.ner_info: In order to recognize your custom entities automatically, existing content has to be annotated with your custom entities. As more content is annotated, training will improve. You can create new custom entities from the Insights page.
stash.settings.processes.paragraph-label: In order to label text blocks automatically, existing text blocks have to be labeled. As more content is labeled, training will improve. You can create new labels from the label sets page.
stash.settings.processes.resource-labele: In order to label resources automatically, existing resources have to be labeled. As more content is labeled, training will improve. You can create new labels from the label sets page.
stash.settings.processes.training.active: There is an active training that you can stop at any time. You will receive an email when it is complete.

upload.use_folder_as_labels.help: First-level folder is the label set name, subfolders are labels. If subfolders are nested, files will get multiple labels. Labels will be created automatically if they are not defined in the Knowledge Box yet.
upload.use_folder_as_labels.label: Use folder names as label names
upload.warning-archive-description:
Archive files (like .zip, .tar, etc.) are supported, but take note that all the files contained in an archive will be gathered in a single resource.

If you expect to get separated results when searching, it is better to extract the files and upload them as separate files.
upload.warning-archive-title: You are about to upload {{num}} archive files
upload.warning-spreadsheet-title: You are about to upload {{num}} spreadsheet files
upload.warning-spreadsheets-description: The semantic indexing of these files might not be optimal depending on their format and structure. See the documentation for more information.
widget.copilot.description: Create and define your AI Copilot by defining a behavior which will generate the user prompt.
widget.copilot.title: Create your AI Copilot
widget.copilot.topic-help: Define behavior according to a given goal. It will impact its tone, its style, its vocabulary, its domain of expertise, or even its opinions.
widget.generator.advanced.display-catego: Enable dark theme on the widget
Display some metadata on the search results
Hide Nuclia logo from search bar
widget.generator.advanced.generative-ans: Generate a response to the user's questions and allow to chat with the system
Show which sources have been used to generate the answer.
Use a different generative model than the default one defined in the Knowledge Box AI settings
Full text results will not be used to generate answers
Customize the message displayed when there's insufficient data to generate a response to the user's question. This field allows HTML markup.
It seems you are not using any variable in this user prompt, it might produce inconsistent answers. Please check the user prompt examples in the settings page.
It will take precedence on the user prompt defined in the Knowledge Box settings. Note: the prompt strategy might change depending on the generative model. Check the examples in the settings page.
Passes entire resource as context when generating answers (instead of just the paragraphs retrieved by the search query)
The field ids have to be in the format {field_type}/{field_name}, like 'a/title', 'a/summary' for title and summary fields or 't/amend' for a text field named 'amend'.
Passes specific fields (designated by their ids) along with the paragraphs retrieved by the search query
widget.generator.advanced.navigation-cat: When using Nuclia to search web pages, clicking on a result will open the original file rather than rendering it in the viewer
When using Nuclia to search web pages, clicking on a result will open the original page rather than rendering it in the viewer
Add extra parameters in URL allowing direct opening of a resource or search results
widget.generator.advanced.ner-category.a: Suggest NERs to autocomplete the search query
widget.generator.advanced.ner-category.k: Allow to show all the relations between entities for a given resource
widget.generator.advanced.ner-category.r: Displays information about NERs in the search results. Cannot be used with the "Match synonyms" option.
widget.generator.advanced.search-and-fil: Detects entities mentioned in the user query and turns them automatically into filters.
Displays filters in the search bar

Filtering will be based on the origin.created value if provided in the resource, otherwise it will default to the resource creation date (created).
Please note: all resources created before 2023-11-02 will have to be reprocessed for origin.created to be filterable.
These filters will be applied to any search queries without being visible to the end users.
When label search intent training has been done, displays labels suggested based on the query
Suggest results while typing search query
Match synonyms in fuzzy search. It cannot be used with the "Relations" option.
widget.generator.presets.ask.long-descri: This is the modality made popular by ChatGPT, where the user asks a question and gets an answer. The system leverages the "Find" experience search results to build a consistent context that will be used by a large language model to generate the answer. The user can ask follow-up questions to get more information.
widget.generator.presets.ask.title: Ask
widget.generator.presets.ask.what-to-sho: The answer and the related search results
What do you want to show?
widget.generator.presets.copilot.descrip: An LLM agent â€“ also called AI copilot â€“ is meant to not only be able to interact with a user through a human-like conversation, but also to behave according to a given goal. It will impact its tone, its style, its vocabulary, its domain of expertise, or even its opinions.
widget.generator.presets.copilot.questio: Do you want to define an AI Copilot?
widget.generator.presets.copilot.title: AI Copilot
widget.generator.presets.description: Select one of the presets or customize your own in the "Advanced" tab.
widget.generator.presets.discover.long-d: In this experience, the user does not know what they want to find. They want to explore a topic and discover related information. Discovery surfaces related pieces of knowledge, information, data, and sources using graph techniques.
widget.generator.presets.discover.title: Discover (beta)
widget.generator.presets.find.long-descr: In this experience, the user is looking for a specific piece of information inside a resource or document. This requires returning the text block where the information is found. This experience sits on top of the standard search experience described above but will also involve semantic search. The user can explain what they are looking for in natural language, and the system will try to understand their intent and find the relevant information.
widget.generator.presets.find.short-desc: Find exact information in a large corpus
widget.generator.presets.find.title: Find
widget.generator.presets.search.long-des: This is the most basic search experience. The user wants to find a document talking about a specific topic providing as a set of keywords. The user can narrow down the results by filtering and ranking. This is what most search engines do today.
widget.generator.presets.search.title: Search
widget.generator.presets.widget-location: A specific application or a document repository
Where will this search widget be located?
widget.generator.private-kb-warning.desc: If the Knowledge Box content is meant to be public, the Knowledge Box owner can publish it from the settings page.
If the Knowledge Box content is meant to be public, you can publish it from the settings page.
widget.generator.private-kb-warning.snip: Don't expose an API key on a public or unsafe website
widget.generator.private-kb-warning.titl: Your Knowledge Box is private, do not embed this widget in a public or unsafe web page.
widget.generator.publish_kb: You can publish it from the
